Package model

Interface IImageModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EightBitImageModel, EightBitImageModelTest.EightBitImageModelTestHelper
    public interface IImageModel
    Represents an Image Processing Model. ImageProcessing. CS 3500 02 - Object-Oriented Design | CS 3501 03 - Lab for CS 3500.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void brighten​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String name, int num)
      Brightens the image (given the key) by adding a given positive integer to the RGB values, and saves it as some name.
      void darken​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String name, int num)
      Darkens the image (given the key) by subtracting a given positive integer from the RGB values, and saves it as some name.
      void flipHoriz​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String name)
      Flips an image (given the key) horizontally, and saves it as some name.
      void flipVert​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String name)
      Flips an image (given the key) vertically, and saves it as some name.
      void greyscale​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String name, PixelComponent component)
      Greyscale an image (given the key) to some RGB component, and saves it as some name.
      void load​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String imageFileName)
      Loads an image into this model given its file name, which will be referred to as some given name.
      void save​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String fileName)
      Saves an image as a file given the image key and the file name.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        void load​(java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String imageFileName)
   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Loads an image into this model given its file name, which will be referred to as some given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name that this model will refer the image to
        imageFileName - the file name of the image
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file name cannot be found or is invalid

      • save

        void save​(java.lang.String key,
          java.lang.String fileName)
   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Saves an image as a file given the image key and the file name.
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to obtain the image
        fileName - the name to save the image as
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist

      • greyscale

        void greyscale​(java.lang.String key,
               java.lang.String name,
               PixelComponent component)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Greyscale an image (given the key) to some RGB component, and saves it as some name.
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to obtain the image
        name - the name to save the greyscale image as
        component - the pixel component to use to greyscale
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist or the given input is an invalid component

      • flipHoriz

        void flipHoriz​(java.lang.String key,
               java.lang.String name)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Flips an image (given the key) horizontally, and saves it as some name.
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to obtain the image
        name - the name to save the flipped image as
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist

       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:
        key - the key used to obtain the image
        name - the name to save the greyscale image as
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist

      • brighten

        void brighten​(java.lang.String key,
              java.lang.String name,
              int num)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Brightens the image (given the key) by adding a given positive integer to the RGB values, and saves it as some name.
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to obtain the image
        name - the name to save the greyscale image as
        num - the positive integer to brighten by
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist or the inputted number is not a positive integer

      • darken

     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Darkens the image (given the key) by subtracting a given positive integer from the RGB values, and saves it as some name.

        name - the name to save the greyscale image as
        num - the positive integer to darken by
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist or the inputted number is not a positive integer
